intro: Lantana pastazensis, commonly known as the Pastaza lantana, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Lantana pastazensis is adapted to humid, tropical climates and thrives in well-drained soils.
